intro: Licania cruegeriana, commonly known as the yellow balsa, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Licania cruegeriana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
